newsitem.title: USA: Near ideal conditions in Florida citrus groves.
newsitem.headline: Near ideal conditions in Florida citrus groves.

text.p: Florida's citrus groves received more rain last Thursday and Friday, the Florida Agricultural Statistics Service (FASS), said. Temperatures prior to the rain were in the mid to low 80's (degrees Fahrenheit) which provided near ideal conditions for bloom according to FASS.
Early and mid orange harvest is complete, with only some clean-up picking going on.
Caretakers are cutting cover crops, hedging, topping, burning dead trees, spraying and spring herbiciding, FASS said.
FASS said an estimated 4,019,000 boxes of Valencia oranges were harvested in the week ended March 23, up from 2,295,000 in the prior week and compared with 1,548,000 during the week ended March 9.
An estimated 207,000 boxes of early and mid oranges were harvested in the week ended March 23, down from 844,000 boxes the prior week, FASS said.
